Intersight:Pools.description: Pools are the basic building blocks for uniquely identifying hardware resources. As the basis for the UCS management model, they allow Service Profiles to be associated with any blade server, while still providing the exact same ID and presentation to the upstream LAN or SAN. If a pool is actively associated with a profile, the pool cannot be deleted.

ip.description:
An IP pool is a sequential range of IP addresses within a certain network. You can assign multiple pool blocks within a pool configuration.
Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * ipv4_blocks
  * ipv4_configuration
  * ipv6_blocks
  * ipv6_configuration
  * reservations
  * tags
Note: For each Address Family IPv4/IPv6, both ipv(4|6)_blocks and ipv(4|6)_configuration must be defined.
ip.title: ip - IP Pool - ippool.Pool

iqn.description:
An IQN pool is a collection of iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) for use as initiator identifiers by iSCSI vNICs. IQN pool members are of the form prefix: suffix: number, where you can specify the prefix, suffix, and a block (range) of numbers.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * iqn_blocks

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * prefix
  * reservations
  * tags
iqn.title: iqn - Iqn Pool - iqnpool.Pool

mac.description:
A MAC pool is a collection of network identities, or MAC addresses, that are unique in their Layer 2 environment and are available to be assigned to vNICs on a server. If you use MAC pools in server profiles, you do not have to manually configure the MAC addresses to be used by the server associated with the server profile.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * mac_blocks

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * reservations
  * tags
mac.title: mac - MAC Pool - macpool.Pool

resource.description:
A resource pool is an aggregation of homogeneous resources that are managed in Intersight. A resource pool enables you to manage the utilization of resources for certain Intersight features like Server Profile. Currently, Intersight supports only server type as a resource for the resource pool.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * serial_number_list

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * pool_type
  * resource_type
  * server_type
  * tags
resource.title: resource - Resource Pool - resourcepool.Pool

uuid.description:
A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) pool is a collection of UUIDs that are assigned to servers. The prefix and suffix of the UUID are variable values. A UUID pool ensures that these variable values are unique for each server associated with a server profile that uses a particular pool to avoid conflicts.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * uuid_blocks

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * prefix
  * reservations
  * tags
uuid.title: uuid - UUID Pool - uuidpool.Pool

wwnn.description:
A WWNN pool is a WWN pool that contains only WW node names. If you include a pool of WWNNs in a server profile, the associated server is assigned a WWNN from that pool.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * id_blocks

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * reservations
  * tags
wwnn.title: wwnn - WWNN Pool - fcpool.Pool

wwpn.description:
A WWPN pool is a WWN pool that contains only WW port names. If you include a pool of WWPNs in a server profile, the port on each vHBA of the associated server is assigned a WWPN from that pool.
Required Attributes:
  * name
  * id_blocks

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * reservations
  * tags
wwpn.title: wwpn - WWPN Pool - fcpool.Pool

Intersight:Pools.title: Pools

common:AssignmentOrder.description:
Assignment order decides the order in which the next identifier is allocated.  Options are:
  * default
  * sequential: (default)
common:AssignmentOrder.title: assignment_order

common:Description.description: Description to Assign to the Pool.
common:Description.title: name

common:Size.description: Size of the Pool.  Allowed range is 1-1024.
common:Size.title: size

key.description: The tag key for which usage information is provided.
key.title: key

value.description: A list of all Tag values that have been assigned to this tag Key.
value.title: value

from.description: Staring WWxN Address.  An Example is `20:00:00:25:B5:00:00:00`
from.title: from

to.description: Ending WWxN Address.  An Example is `20:00:00:25:B5:00:04:00`
to.title: to

tags.description:
An arbitrary key and value pair that can be used to tag REST resources and organize managed objects by
assigning meta-data tags to any object.
Required Attributes:
  * key
  * value
tags.title: tags - Tags

id_blocks.description:
A block of WW(N|P) addresses.

Required Attributes:
  * from

Optional Attributes:
  * size
  * to
Note: Only assign either size or to, not both.
id_blocks.title: id_blocks

pool_purpose.description:
Purpose of this WWN pool.
Options are:
  * WWNN
  * WWPN: (defualt)
pool_purpose.title: pool_purpose

fcpool.Reservations.description:
The WWxN reservation object, used to hold reserved addresses.
Required Attributes:
  * identities

Optional Attributes:
  * allocation_type

allocation_type.description:
Type of the allocation for the identity in the reservation either static or dynamic (i.e. via pool).
  * dynamic - Identifiers to be allocated by system.
  * static - Identifiers are assigned by the user.  (default)
allocation_type.title: allocation_type

identities.description: List of WWxN identities to be reserved.

items.description: WWN identity to be reserved.  Example `20:00:00:25:B5:00:00:00`
items.title: identity

identities.title: identities

fcpool.Reservations.title: WWNN/WWPN Reservations

from.description: First IPv4 address of the block.  Example `198.18.0.10`.
from.title: from

to.description: Last IPv4 address of the block. Example `198.18.0.250`.
to.title: to

ippool.IpV4Config.description:
Network interface configuration data for IPv4 interfaces. Netmask, Gateway and DNS settings.

Required Attributes:
  * gateway
  * netmask
  * primary_dns

Optional Attributes:
  * secondary_dns.

gateway.description: Gateway to assign to the pool.  Example `198.18.0.1`.
gateway.title: gateway

netmask.description: A subnet mask is a 32-bit number that masks an IP address and divides the IP address into network address and host address.  Example `255.255.255.0`.
netmask.title: netmask

primary_dns.description: IP Address of the primary Domain Name System (DNS) server.  Example `208.67.220.220`.
primary_dns.title: primary_dns

secondary_dns.description: IP Address of the secondary Domain Name System (DNS) server.  Example `208.67.222.222`.
secondary_dns.title: secondary_dns

ippool.IpV4Config.title: ipv4_configuration - IPv4 Configuration Settings

from.description: First IPv6 address of the block.  Example `2001:db8::10`.
from.title: from

to.description: Last IPv6 address of the block.  Example `2001:db8::250`.
to.title: to

ippool.IpV6Config.description:
Network interface configuration data for IPv6 interfaces. Prefix, Gateway and DNS settings.

Required Attributes:
  * gateway
  * prefix
  * primary_dns

Optional Attributes:
  * secondary_dns.

gateway.description: Gateway to assign to the pool.  Example `2001:db8::1`.
gateway.title: gateway

prefix.description: Prefix to assign to the pool.  Example `64`.
prefix.title: prefix

primary_dns.description: IP Address of the primary Domain Name System (DNS) server.  Example `2620:119:53::53`.
primary_dns.title: primary_dns

secondary_dns.description: IP Address of the secondary Domain Name System (DNS) server.  Example `2620:119:35::35`.
secondary_dns.title: secondary_dns

ippool.IpV6Config.title: ipv6_configuration - IPv6 Configuration Settings

ippool.Pool.description: Pool represents a collection of IPv4 and/or IPv6 addresses that can be allocated to other configuration entities like server profiles.

ipv4_blocks.description:
A block of IPv4 addresses.

Required Attributes:
  * from

Optional Attributes:
  * size
  * to
Note: Only assign either size or to, not both.
ipv4_blocks.title: ipv4_blocks

ipv6_blocks.description:
A block of IPv6 addresses.

Required Attributes:
  * from

Optional Attributes:
  * size
  * to
Note: Only assign either size or to, not both.
ipv6_blocks.title: ipv6_blocks

tags.description:
An arbitrary key and value pair that can be used to tag REST resources and organize managed objects by
assigning meta-data tags to any object.
Required Attributes:
  * key
  * value
tags.title: tags - Tags

ippool.Pool.title: ip - IP Pool for Chassis and Server Address Allocation.

ippool.Reservations.description:
The IP reservation object, used to hold reserved addresses.
Required Attributes:
  * identities

Optional Attributes:
  * allocation_type
  * ip_type

allocation_type.description:
Type of the allocation for the identity in the reservation either static or dynamic (i.e. via pool).
  * dynamic - Identifiers to be allocated by system.
  * static - Identifiers are assigned by the user.  (default)
allocation_type.title: allocation_type

ip_type.description:
Type of the IP address that needs to be reserved.
  * IPv4 - IP V4 address type requested. (default)
  * IPv6 - IP V6 address type requested.
ip_type.title: ip_type

identities.description: List of IP identities to be reserved.

items.description: IP identity to be reserved.  Example `198.18.1.1` or `2001:db8::1`
items.title: identity

identities.title: identities

ippool.Reservations.title: Identity Reservations

from.description: Staring IQN Address.  An Exmaple is `0`.
from.title: from

suffix.description: Suffix to assign to the IQN Pool.  An Exmaple is `ucs-host`.
suffix.title: suffix

to.description: Ending IQN Address.  An Exmaple is `1024`.
to.title: to

iqn_blocks.description:
A block of IQN addresses.

Required Attributes:
  * from
  * suffix

Optional Attributes:
  * size
  * to
Note: Only assign either size or to, not both.
iqn_blocks.title: iqn_blocks

prefix.description: The prefix for any IQN blocks created for this pool. IQN Prefix must have the following format `iqn.yyyy-mm.naming-authority`, where naming-authority is usually the reverse syntax of the Internet domain name of the naming authority.  The default is `iqn.1984-12.com.cisco`.
prefix.title: prefix

NamePrefixSuffix.description:
A List of (Pre|Suf)fixes to add to the Pool Names.
 Options are:
  * default
  * ip
  * iqn
  * mac
  * resource
  * uuid
  * wwnn
  * wwpn

default.description: A Value to add to the Name of all pools.  An individual pool prefix/suffix will override this.
default.title: default

ip.description: A Value to add to IP Pool Names.
ip.title: ip

iqn.description: A Value to add to IQN Pool Names.
iqn.title: iqn

mac.description: A Value to add to MAC Pool Names.
mac.title: mac

resource.description: A Value to add to Resource Pool Names.
resource.title: resource

uuid.description: A Value to add to UUID Pool Names.
uuid.title: uuid

wwnn.description: A Prefix / Suffix to add to WWNN Pool Names.
wwnn.title: wwnn

wwpn.description: A Prefix / Suffix to add to WWPN Pool Names.
wwpn.title: wwpn

NamePrefixSuffix.title: Name Prefix and Suffix

pool_type.description:
The resource management type in the pool, it can be either static or dynamic.
  * Static - The resources in the pool will not be changed until user manually update it. (default)
  * Dynamic - The resources in the pool will be updated dynamically based on the condition.
pool_type.title: pool_type

resource_type.description:
The type of the resource present in the pool, example 'server' its combination of RackUnit and Blade.
  * None - The resource cannot consider for Resource Pool.
  * Server - Resource Pool holds the server kind of resources, example - RackServer, Blade. (default)
resource_type.title: resource_type

serial_number_list.description: A List of Compute Serial Numbers to assign to the policy.  These must be the same type of server. Cannot be some blades and some rackmounts.
serial_number_list.title: serial_number_list

server_type.description:
The Server type to add to the selection filter field.  This is combined with the Serial Number List for the selector criteria.  Options are:
  * Blades: (default)
  * RackUnits
server_type.title: server_type

An arbitrary key and value pair that can be used to tag REST resources and organize managed objects by
assigning meta-data tags to any object.

prefix.description: Prefix to assign to the UUID Pool..  The default is `000025B5-0000-0000`
